data.title: Karachi nuclear power plant
data.text:
Part of the

Global Nuclear Power Tracker,

a Global Energy Monitor project.

Other names: KANUPP

Karachi nuclear power plant is an operating nuclear power plant in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan.

Project Details

Table 1: Unit-level project details for Karachi nuclear power plant

Unit name Status Commissioning year Retirement year Nameplate capacity Reactor type Model Owner Operator 1 Retired[1] 1972[1] 2021[1] 100 MW[1] Pressurized heavy water reactor[1] CANDU-137 MW[1] Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission [100%][1] Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission[1] 2 Operating[2] 2021[2] – 1100 MW[2] Pressurized water reactor[2] ACP-1000[2] Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission [100%][2] Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission[2] 3 Operating[3] 2022[3] – 1100 MW[3] Pressurized water reactor[3] ACP-1000[3] Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission [100%][3] Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission[3]

Unit name Construction start First criticality (more info) First grid connection Commercial operation Retirement date 1 August 1, 1966[1] August 1, 1971[1] October 18, 1971[1] December 7, 1972[1] August 1, 2021[1] 2 August 20, 2015[2] February 28, 2021[2] March 18, 2021[2] May 21, 2021[2] – 3 May 31, 2016[3] February 21, 2022[3] March 4, 2022[3] April 18, 2022[3] –
